resources.string: The Aborigines replace the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Standing stone[COLOR_REVERT] with the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bora Ring[COLOR_REVERT], which is cheaper to construct.
A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Temple of Ishtar[COLOR_REVERT] is a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Brothel[COLOR_REVERT] that allows two Priests.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Garrison[COLOR_REVERT] is replaced by the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Llogor[COLOR_REVERT] in the Albanian civilization. It gives Gunpowder units extra experience.
The Moot Hill is the Anglo-Saxon replacement for the courthouse. It gives extra Defense.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Midewiwins[COLOR_REVERT] (the Anishnaabek replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Healer's hut[COLOR_REVERT]) allow you to turn 1 extra citizen in the city into a Scientist.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Healer's Hut[COLOR_REVERT] replacement for the Aniyonega civilization is the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Didanawisgi[COLOR_REVERT] and it heals one unit fully per turn in addition.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Smoke House[COLOR_REVERT] increase a city's wealth. They also increase the city's happiness with access to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fur[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ivory[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Silk[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Whales[COLOR_REVERT], or[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Horses[COLOR_REVERT].
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Opera House[COLOR_REVERT] is replaced by the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Dance Studio[COLOR_REVERT] for Argentina, and it provides a medium culture boost.
A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Khachkar[COLOR_REVERT] (the Armenian replacement for a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Healer's Hut[COLOR_REVERT]) provides Culture.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Armuarie[COLOR_REVERT] replaces the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Armourer[COLOR_REVERT] and provides additional military production to the city in which it is built.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Drumming Station[COLOR_REVERT], the Ashanti replacement for a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Courthouse[COLOR_REVERT],provides an additional bonus to espionage.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Athletics Complex[COLOR_REVERT], the Australian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stadium[COLOR_REVERT]
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hofmuseen[COLOR_REVERT], the Austrian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Museum[COLOR_REVERT], offers more Culture and Science.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Baktrian Mint[COLOR_REVERT] replaces the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bank[COLOR_REVERT] which is available earlier, and slightly cheaper.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kabaddi Centre[COLOR_REVERT] (the Bangladeshi replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arena[COLOR_REVERT]) increases a city's happiness.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Batavian Stable[COLOR_REVERT] replaces the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Knight's Stable[COLOR_REVERT] and provides an additional +5exp for all mounted units in the city in which it is built.

Belgium replaces the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Grocer[COLOR_REVERT] with the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fritkot[COLOR_REVERT], which is cheaper to build and provides extra happiness, but has an associated health reduction.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Chuao Fields[COLOR_REVERT] increase a city's wealth with an additional commerce bonus. They also increase the city's happiness with access to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fur[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ivory[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Silk[COLOR_REVERT], or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Whales[COLOR_REVERT].
The Brazilian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stadium[COLOR_REVERT] is the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Estadio de Futbol[COLOR_REVERT], provides a free Celebrity.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Broch[COLOR_REVERT], the Scottish replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Castle[COLOR_REVERT], prevents enemies from invading, unless they bombard your city.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Paya[COLOR_REVERT] is the Burmese replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Scriptorium[COLOR_REVERT]. It provides a gold bonus within the city it is built.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Copperworks[COLOR_REVERT] (the Chilean replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Factory[COLOR_REVERT]) increase a city's production and wealth at the cost of adding significant unhealthiness. They get an added bonus with [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Copper[COLOR_REVERT].
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Chitalishte[COLOR_REVERT], the Bulgarian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Library[COLOR_REVERT], can turn two citizens into artists.
[TAB]The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Trade Workshop[COLOR_REVERT] is the Chola replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Market[COLOR_REVERT] and gives every unit built in a city the Amphibious Promotion.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Chorten[COLOR_REVERT], the Tibetan replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monument[COLOR_REVERT], offers bonus happiness.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cloister[COLOR_REVERT], the Lombard replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arena[COLOR_REVERT], adds a free priest.
Colombia replaces the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Grocer[COLOR_REVERT] with the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Coffee Estate[COLOR_REVERT], which provides massive bonuses with Coffee.

A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Nkisi[COLOR_REVERT] (the Congo replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Healer Hut[COLOR_REVERT]) are an inexpensive way to help units heal damage more quickly and add health to a city.
A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cortigiane Oneste[COLOR_REVERT] is a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Brothel[COLOR_REVERT] that gives a free Artist.
Croatia replaces [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]High Walls[COLOR_REVERT] with the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]King's Tower[COLOR_REVERT]. It gives units built in the city a free Guerrilla promotion.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Vysilacs[COLOR_REVERT] greatly increase a city's cultural output and are less expensive than the standard [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Broadcast Tower[COLOR_REVERT]. They also provide two happy citizens for Hit Singles, Movies or Musicals.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Manor Houses[COLOR_REVERT] (the Danish replacement for [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Castles[COLOR_REVERT]) increase your city's defenses against pre-gunpowder units, increase espionage output, gold, and generate a small amount of culture. Build them in cities near enemy civilizations.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hogans[COLOR_REVERT] increase a city's wealth and culture. They also increase the city's happiness with access to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fur[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ivory[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Silk[COLOR_REVERT], or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Whales[COLOR_REVERT].

A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fanum[COLOR_REVERT] (the Etruscan replacement for a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Courthouse[COLOR_REVERT]) lowers city maintenance costs and is required to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Forbidden Palace[COLOR_REVERT] national wonder. A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fanum[COLOR_REVERT] also allows you to convert two citizens to a Priest.
Finland's replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bath House[COLOR_REVERT] is the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sauna[COLOR_REVERT], which provides extra happiness and has no resource requirement.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Folwark[COLOR_REVERT], the Polish replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Granary[COLOR_REVERT], offers bonus food.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Furdo[COLOR_REVERT], the Hungarian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bath House[COLOR_REVERT], offers bonus health.
Build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sakhioba Theatre[COLOR_REVERT] to receive happiness, and turn 4 citizens into artist. It replaces the normal theatre for the Georgian people.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Getic River Port[COLOR_REVERT] replaces the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Levee[COLOR_REVERT] and provides an additional trade bonus and health bonus the city in which it is built.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Plunder[COLOR_REVERT] (the Goth replacement for a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Jail[COLOR_REVERT]) lowers a city's [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]War Weariness[COLOR_REVERT] and increases gold. Build this if you are involved in a long war and your citizens are starting to complain.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Venus Temple[COLOR_REVERT], the Toltec replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Altar[COLOR_REVERT], grants melee units one bonus experience in addition to the usual culture bonus.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hambar[COLOR_REVERT], the Serbian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Granary[COLOR_REVERT], grants additional food and health with corn.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sewer[COLOR_REVERT], the Harappan replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sewer System[COLOR_REVERT] are available earlier and reduced espionage penalty.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hockey Rink[COLOR_REVERT], the Canadian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stadium[COLOR_REVERT], offers a free Celebrity in exchange for slight Maintenace.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Végvárs[COLOR_REVERT] replace [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]castles[COLOR_REVERT]; they increase city defense, espionage, science and culture. It also exerts a zone of control around your city to guard your borders. Happiness also rises if wine is available. Build végvárs near your empire's borders where your cities are in danger of attack by your enemies.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cattle Herd[COLOR_REVERT] is the Hunnic replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Butchery[COLOR_REVERT]. It provides units built in the city with the Formation I promotion.
Indonesia replaces the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Grocer[COLOR_REVERT] with the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Spice Stocks[COLOR_REVERT], which give a gold boost.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]IMIDRO[COLOR_REVERT] replaces the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Laboratory[COLOR_REVERT] and adds production.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mesopotamian Museum[COLOR_REVERT], the Iraqi replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Museum[COLOR_REVERT], offers additional gold in the city in which it's built.

A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Carnevale[COLOR_REVERT] (the Italian replacement for a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Theatre[COLOR_REVERT]) increases a city's culture and happiness. It is also required to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Globe Theatre[COLOR_REVERT] national wonder.
An [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Oasis[COLOR_REVERT] (the Kanem-Bornu replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bank[COLOR_REVERT]) increases a city's Health.
The Kazakh Horse Farm replaces the stable and provides abonus to Health and Happiness with horses.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kurgan[COLOR_REVERT], the Khazar replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monument[COLOR_REVERT], offers reduced War Weariness.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Berber Pasture[COLOR_REVERT] is the Maghreb replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Granary[COLOR_REVERT] and gives a health boost.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Caitra Tribute[COLOR_REVERT] (the Majapahit replacement for [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Courthouse[COLOR_REVERT]) provides a free Merchant.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Opera House[COLOR_REVERT] is replaced by the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Salegy Hall[COLOR_REVERT] in the Malagasy civilization. It provides a percentage-based culture boost.

A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Poro[COLOR_REVERT] will lower city maintenance costs and is required to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Forbidden Palace[COLOR_REVERT] national wonder. It also helps manage the cost of controlling large empires as well as reduce War Weariness.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Barracks[COLOR_REVERT] replacement for the Mapuche civilization is the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Toqui Hut[COLOR_REVERT] and it gives a free Shock promotion.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Marae[COLOR_REVERT], the Polynesian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Altar[COLOR_REVERT], offers bonus culture.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Exhibition[COLOR_REVERT], the Egyptian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Museum[COLOR_REVERT], grants an additional trade route.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Menara[COLOR_REVERT], the Cham replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Scriptorium[COLOR_REVERT], provides your city with a defense bonus.

A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Charreada Arena[COLOR_REVERT] (the Mexican replacement for a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arena[COLOR_REVERT]) increases a city's happiness and its happiness output from using the culture slider. It will also provide extra experience to your mounted units.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Anaktora[COLOR_REVERT] is the Minoan replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Courthouse[COLOR_REVERT] and add extra culture and trade routes.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Huaca[COLOR_REVERT], the Moche replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monument[COLOR_REVERT], grants an additional trade route in the city in which it is built.

A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Zimba[COLOR_REVERT] increases your city's defenses aganst pre-gunpowder units and generates a small amount of culture. They are more expensive than the standard [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Castle[COLOR_REVERT] but will reduce city maintenace by 20 percent.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Woolsheds[COLOR_REVERT] increase a city's wealth. They also increase the city's health with access to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Spices[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sugar[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wine[COLOR_REVERT], or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bananas[COLOR_REVERT]. Additional culture is provided if the city has access to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sheep[COLOR_REVERT].

A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Juju Hall[COLOR_REVERT] increases a city's culture and increases the happiness output from using the culture slider. They also provide culture and are required to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Globe Theatre[COLOR_REVERT] national wonder. The Nigerian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Theatre[COLOR_REVERT] allows provides one free Priest specialist.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stockfish[COLOR_REVERT] is great for growth, if you have the resources.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stone Heads[COLOR_REVERT] (the Olmec replacement for [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monuments[COLOR_REVERT]) provide lower maintenance, and are a good way to expand city borders early on.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]ISI[COLOR_REVERT] are the Pakistani replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Intelligence Agency[COLOR_REVERT]. It provides extra EXP for Gunpowder Units.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Frahangestan[COLOR_REVERT] replaces the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]library[COLOR_REVERT] and provides an additional science boost to the city in which it is built.
A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Nipa Hut[COLOR_REVERT] (the Flippino replacement for a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Granary[COLOR_REVERT]) increases the production generated within a city.

A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Dye Facility[COLOR_REVERT] (the Phoenician replacement for a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Custom House[COLOR_REVERT]) increases the commerce generated by a city's Foreign Intercontinental Trade Routes. Consider using it in conjunction with the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Free Market[COLOR_REVERT] Civic. Commerce bonus with Dye.

A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Crannog[COLOR_REVERT] (the Pictish replacement for a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Harbor[COLOR_REVERT]) increases that city's income from trade routes and extra defense. It increases a city's health from access to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Clam[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Crab[COLOR_REVERT], and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fish[COLOR_REVERT] resources.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Piliakalnis[COLOR_REVERT], the Lithuanian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Castle[COLOR_REVERT], offers bonus health.

A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sweat Lodge[COLOR_REVERT] helps units heal damage more quickly and adds health and Happiness to a city. They are required to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Red Cross[COLOR_REVERT] national wonder.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kurash[COLOR_REVERT] is a cheaper replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Barracks[COLOR_REVERT].
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ringfort[COLOR_REVERT], the Irish replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Castle[COLOR_REVERT], offers bonus defense.
Scythia replaces the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stables[COLOR_REVERT] with [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Scythian Stables[COLOR_REVERT], which give units built in the city a free March promotion.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Seleukeion[COLOR_REVERT] replaces the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Courthouse[COLOR_REVERT] and provides additional gold in the city it is built.
[TAB]The Seljuk replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]University[COLOR_REVERT] gives an extra 1 health.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ajuuraan Markets[COLOR_REVERT] act like regular [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Markets[COLOR_REVERT], except they provide +2 Food.

A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Braai[COLOR_REVERT] increases the health and happiness of cities, if they have access to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Deer[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cows[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pigs[COLOR_REVERT], or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sheep[COLOR_REVERT].
A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Zoll[COLOR_REVERT] (the Swiss replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bank[COLOR_REVERT]) increases a city's gold.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ting[COLOR_REVERT], the Swedish replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Courthouse[COLOR_REVERT], grants additional health.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Club Tropicana[COLOR_REVERT] has a greater Gold and Culture bonus than the Casino.

A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Trojan Agora[COLOR_REVERT] (the Trojan replacement for a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Market[COLOR_REVERT]) increases a city's wealth and can convert an extra citizen in merchant. It also increases a city's happiness with access to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fur[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ivory[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Silk[COLOR_REVERT], or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Whales[COLOR_REVERT].

A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Maloca[COLOR_REVERT] will lower city maintenance costs and is required to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Forbidden Palace[COLOR_REVERT] national wonder. It also helps manage the cost of controlling large empires as well as increase culture in the city.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Urhokpota[COLOR_REVERT] replaces Courthouse and it grants 1 Artist.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Grape Arbors[COLOR_REVERT] increase a city's culture and commerce, and can increase the happiness output from using the culture slider. A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Grape Arbor[COLOR_REVERT] also provides culture and is required to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Globe Theatre[COLOR_REVERT] national wonder.
[TAB]The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Veche[COLOR_REVERT], the Ukrainian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Courthouse[COLOR_REVERT], offers additional food.

A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Vedas[COLOR_REVERT] will boost your city's research, provide culture and one free Priest. They are required to build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Universities[COLOR_REVERT], the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Great Library[COLOR_REVERT] wonder, and the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]National Epic[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Heroic Epic[COLOR_REVERT] national wonders.
The Vietnamese replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Market[COLOR_REVERT] is the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Open Market[COLOR_REVERT], which gives a minor production boost and is cheaper to build.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Villu Statue[COLOR_REVERT], the Hurrian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Courthouse[COLOR_REVERT], provides a free Priest, but cannot turn a citizen into a Spy.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cricket Grounds[COLOR_REVERT] (the West Indies replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Opera House[COLOR_REVERT]) has Merchant specialists instead of Artists, a slight gold bonus, and additional happiness bonus.

A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Noin-Ula Kurgan[COLOR_REVERT] (the Xiongnu replacement for a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monument[COLOR_REVERT]) gives a boost to culture and allows you to turn one citizen into an [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Artist[COLOR_REVERT]. It is a good way to expand city borders early on.
Yemen replaces the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Healer's Hut[COLOR_REVERT] with the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Qat Field[COLOR_REVERT], which provides extra happiness and has a slight maintenance reduction.
